ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would enthusiastically recommend the course to anybody with an interest in twentieth-century history, politics or economics.

I would definitely recommend this class. As an Americanist this introduced me to crucial international issues I didn't even realize I needed to know about in order to understand certain events in Am. history. This is a tough class with difficult reading, so I would recommend it either in a semester without two other tough classes or as an audit! It's kind of like jumping into the lion's den.Probably it would be much less difficult for someone in economics or with strong European history background.
I recommend this class wholeheartedly. It covered the stated subject matter very well, balancing discussions between continental Europe, Britain, and the United States.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: The course challenged me to see topics that I had studied in a totally new light, and encouraged me to make connections where I previously might not have.
